I also had parts of my dream come true. In my real life. Nothing exciting. Like me sitting on a weird couch in my living room writing with a silver paint marker on paper. It was a boring dream. Well. 5 years later I was a senior in high school we got new furniture and I was filling out locker decorations for our winter homecoming. So my mind went back to that dream… it came true.

So I believe the “mental science of dreams” is all BS. Just a huge bunch of speculation.

i had a sleep study done recently where we found out i completely skip deep sleep and go from n2 to REM a couple dozen times a night. but wait, it gets better! i do this when i'm AWAKE, too! this results in my life being an actual literal living nightmare, what with the hallucinations, severe fatigue, memory loss, and all the other symptoms of severe sleep deprivation. i can go up to 2 weeks without ever getting any deep sleep and it's been 2 years of this shit, still no diagnoses, (current theory is narcolepsy) and no treatment. i'm bedridden and i legit feel like i'm a slowly decomposing corpse. please, everyone, make sure you get good quality sleep if you are capable of it. you have no idea how much your life depends on it.

I do also have a sleep disorder that I've gone through medical routes (medical Dr sleep specialists) to try to diagnose, treat, monitor, etc.
Warning: the following gets a little dark.
The sleep disorder caused me to not be able to enter REM stage AT ALL in my sleep for more than a year, which my Drs and I discovered after monitoring my sleep several times with a couple different types of equipment. I remember wires and sticky putty. During this time, my previously experienced narcoleptic attacks reemerged with a vengeance from a period of dormancy. l had frequent bouts of much more prolonged narcoleptic attacks than before, suddenly falling asleep uncontrollably and STAYING asleep uncontrollably for looong periods of time, in the 16-48 hour range (before, it was 45min-8hr range.
I had night terrors every time I slept and would often wake up screaming, sweating, and thrashing. So... the thing about REM sleep being used to restore emotional issues to a level of normalcy probably checks out.
